definitions: Clean out the bed of (a harbor, river, or other area of water) with a dredge.
Bring up or clear (something) from the bottom of a river or sea with a dredge.
Search for something by sifting through mud or sand.
Unearth or bring to light (something forgotten or unpleasant).
examples: They dredged the river for lost artifacts.
The team dredged up old memories during the reunion.
He dredged the bottom of the lake for the missing keys.
The canal was dredged to improve navigation.
